trans-unit.source: Represents a security token that is based upon key that is created using the RSA algorithm.

Typically, application developers do not need to use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken> class, unless a Web service must get the RSA algorithm that is associated with the security token.
To get the RSA algorithm, get the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken.Rsa%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified RSA algorithm.
This constructor generates a unique identifier for the security token and sets that to the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken.Id%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.RSA"></xref> that represents a RSA algorithm that is capable of creating an asymmetric key.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken.Rsa"></xref> property.
rsa is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified RSA algorithm and unique identifier.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.RSA"></xref> that represents a RSA algorithm that is capable of creating an asymmetric key.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken.Rsa"></xref> property.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken.Id"></xref> property.
rsa is `null`.
-or-
id is `null`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this security token is capable of creating the specified key identifier.
To create the key identifier clause, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that specifies the type of key identifier to create.
`true` when T is of type ; otherwise, `false`.
Creates the specified key identifier clause.

To determine whether the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken> class can create the specified key identifier clause, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken.CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that specifies the key identifier to create.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that is a key identifier clause for the security token.
Allows the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken"></xref> to free resources before it is destroyed by the garbage collector.
Gets a unique identifier of the security token.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Returns a value that indicates whether the key identifier for this instance matches the specified key identifier.
`true` if skiClause is of type and the keys match; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a RSA algorithm that is capable of creating an asymmetric key.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.RSA"></xref> that represents a RSA algorithm that is capable of creating an asymmetric key.
Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
The collection contains an asymmetric key that is created using the RSA algorithm.
The key is of type <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityKey>.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.
Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to the instant in time when the security token is created in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.RsaSecurityToken> security token never expires.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
